normalised: telecom sector sees accelerated fiber to home rollout

unnormalised: New Delhi – Telecom operators across India are aggressively expanding their Fiber-to-Home (FTTH) infrastructure, driven by increasing demand for high-speed internet. Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are leading the charge, with significant investments planned for the next fiscal year.
normalised: new delhi – telecom operators across India are aggressively expanding their fiber to home (F T T H) infrastructure, driven by increasing demand for high speed internet. reliance jio and bharti airtel are leading the charge, with significant investments planned for the next fiscal year.

unnormalised: Industry analysts at Dr. Verma Associates predict a 30% year-on-year growth in FTTH subscriptions. The government's BharatNet project is also playing a crucial role, aiming to connect rural areas with fiber optic cables.
normalised: industry analysts at doctor verma associates predict a thirty percent year on year growth in F T T H subscriptions. the government's bharat net project is also playing a crucial role, aiming to connect rural areas with fiber optic cables.

unnormalised: "We are witnessing a data revolution in India," stated Mr. Sharma, CEO of a prominent telecom firm, adding "FTTH is crucial for enabling services like online education and telemedicine, especially in remote regions."
normalised: "we are witnessing a data revolution in India," stated mister sharma, C E O of a prominent telecom firm, adding "F T T H is crucial for enabling services like online education and telemedicine, especially in remote regions."

unnormalised: The investment in FTTH is estimated to be around Rs. 20,000 Cr. this year. Recent reports indicate that over 50,000 km of fiber optic cable was laid across the country in Q3 alone. The average household now requires speeds capable of supporting multiple devices within a 1500 sq ft apartment. This expansion is expected to boost economic activity and improve the digital literacy rate across the nation.
normalised: the investment in F T T H is estimated to be around rupee twenty thousand crore this year. recent reports indicate that over fifty thousand kilometer of fiber optic cable was laid across the country in Q three alone. the average household now requires speeds capable of supporting multiple devices within a one thousand five hundred square feet apartment. this expansion is expected to boost economic activity and improve the digital literacy rate across the nation.
